intro: Sisymbrium curvisiliquum, commonly known as the bent-silique vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its fruit is a slender silique, which is a type of dry, dehiscent fruit typical of the family. Sisymbrium curvisiliquum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including meadows and roadsides.
